deliberation: I distinguished (1) 'I will sow her for Me in the land' as an agricultural metaphor for replanting the people and (2) the reuse of the symbolic names Lo-Ruhamah and Lo-Ammi as metonymies for relational status reversal.

instances.english_text: And take Lo-ruhamah back in favor; And I will say to Lo-ammi, “You are My people,” And he will respond, “[You are] my God.”
target: Israel’s changed covenant status from rejection to acceptance
restored mutual confession between God and people
vehicle: the names 'Lo-Ruhamah'/'Lo-Ammi' and their reversal into 'Ruhamah'/'Ammi', plus reciprocal speech
ground: names and mutual declarations encapsulate the entire relational shift
a label and a spoken formula representing identity and belonging

instances.explanation: The previously negative names 'Lo-Ruhamah' ('Not-Compassioned') and 'Lo-Ammi' ('Not-My-People') are used metonymically; their reversal and the mutual 'You are my people'/'my God' declarations signify complete restoration of the covenant relationship.
